title: What are some mistakes that amateur writers make which professional writers don't? - Quora

response.answer_text: The most common mistake is overwriting. For example, when creating characters, inexperienced writers describe physical appearance giving all the details. But we remember people in “parts.” For example, we may fall in love with someone for their voice, not their physical appearance. It’s important to draw attention to one or two memorable things that define a person. Don’t deprive your readers of the pleasure of their own imaginings! Sometimes, inexperienced authors tell the reader things instead of showing them. For instance, X was scared. Instead, show X shrinking away from whatever scares him/her. Let the reader fill in the details. Inexperienced writers may sometimes let their own voice leak into what their characters say. Give your characters the freedom to be themselves. Another mistake is to be overly concerned with plot. My tip is to let your characters lead and tell the story. This list is by no means complete. But these are my major gripes.

They write whatever they feel like without checking whether there is an audience for that type of genre of stories/novel.They try to get their 1st draft published, while professional authors go through many drafts.They try to get published without getting it professionally edited. These are just a few mistakes made by new “wannabe” authors”.
